creator: Anthony Ha
title: (No AI) OpenAI’s Sam Altman announces Pentagon deal with ‘technical safeguards’
dc:creator: Anthony Ha
content: OpenAI's CEO claims its new defense contract includes protections addressing the same issues that became a flashpoint for Anthropic.
contentSnippet: OpenAI's CEO claims its new defense contract includes protections addressing the same issues that became a flashpoint for Anthropic.

creator: Russell Brandom
title: (No AI) Pentagon moves to designate Anthropic as a supply-chain risk
dc:creator: Russell Brandom
content: "We don't need it, we don't want it, and will not do business with them again," the president wrote in the post.
contentSnippet: "We don't need it, we don't want it, and will not do business with them again," the president wrote in the post.

title: (No AI) Defense secretary Pete Hegseth designates Anthropic a supply chain risk
author: Tina Nguyen
content:
![](https://platform.theverge.com/wp-content/uploads/sites/2/2026/02/gettyimages-2253879905.jpg?quality=90&strip=all&crop=0,0,100,100)

US President Donald Trump (R) looks on as US Secretary of Defense Pete Hegseth speaks to the press following US military actions in Venezuela | AFP via Getty Images

Nearly two hours after President Donald Trump announced on Truth Social that he was [banning Anthropic products from the federal government](https://www.theverge.com/policy/886489/pentagon-anthropic-trump-dod), Secretary of Defense Pete Hegseth took it one step further and announced that he was now designating the AI company as a "supply-chain risk," which Anthropic [says](https://www.anthropic.com/news/statement-comments-secretary-war) it is willing to challenge in court.

The decision could immediately impact numerous major tech companies that use Claude in their line of work for the Pentagon, including Palantir and AWS. It is not immediately clear to what extent the Pentagon may blacklist companies that contract with Claude for other services outside of national security, A …

[Read the full story at The Verge.](https://www.theverge.com/policy/886632/pentagon-designates-anthropic-supply-chain-risk-ai-standoff)
contentSnippet:
US President Donald Trump (R) looks on as US Secretary of Defense Pete Hegseth speaks to the press following US military actions in Venezuela | AFP via Getty Images	

Nearly two hours after President Donald Trump announced on Truth Social that he was banning Anthropic products from the federal government, Secretary of Defense Pete Hegseth took it one step further and announced that he was now designating the AI company as a "supply-chain risk," which Anthropic says it is willing to challenge in court.
The decision could immediately impact numerous major tech companies that use Claude in their line of work for the Pentagon, including Palantir and AWS. It is not immediately clear to what extent the Pentagon may blacklist companies that contract with Claude for other services outside of national security, A …
Read the full story at The Verge.
summary: Nearly two hours after President Donald Trump announced on Truth Social that he was banning Anthropic products from the federal government, Secretary of Defense Pete Hegseth took it one step further and announced that he was now designating the AI company as a "supply-chain risk," which Anthropic says it is willing to challenge in court. title: (No AI) Trump orders federal agencies to drop Anthropic’s AI
author: Hayden Field
content:
![An image of Trump](https://platform.theverge.com/wp-content/uploads/sites/2/2025/02/STK466_ELECTION_2024_CVirginia_E.jpg?quality=90&strip=all&crop=0,0,100,100)

On Friday afternoon, Donald Trump [posted on Truth Social](https://truthsocial.com/@realDonaldTrump/posts/116144552969293195), accusing Anthropic, the AI company behind Claude, of attempting to "STRONG-ARM" the Pentagon and directing federal agencies to "IMMEDIATELY CEASE" use of its products. At issue is Anthropic CEO Dario Amodei's [refusal](https://www.theverge.com/news/885773/anthropic-department-of-defense-dod-pentagon-refusal-terms-hegseth-dario-amodei) of an updated agreement with the US military agreeing to "any lawful use" of Anthropic's technology, as Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth mandated in a January memo, to the frustration of many tech workers [across the industry](https://www.theverge.com/ai-artificial-intelligence/885963/anthropic-dod-pentagon-tech-workers-ai-labs-react).

As we explained [earlier this week](https://www.theverge.com/ai-artificial-intelligence/883456/anthropic-pentagon-department-of-defense-negotiations), that agreement would give the US military access to use the company's services for mass domestic surveillance and …

[Read the full story at The Verge.](https://www.theverge.com/policy/886489/pentagon-anthropic-trump-dod)
contentSnippet:
On Friday afternoon, Donald Trump posted on Truth Social, accusing Anthropic, the AI company behind Claude, of attempting to "STRONG-ARM" the Pentagon and directing federal agencies to "IMMEDIATELY CEASE" use of its products. At issue is Anthropic CEO Dario Amodei's refusal of an updated agreement with the US military agreeing to "any lawful use" of Anthropic's technology, as Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth mandated in a January memo, to the frustration of many tech workers across the industry.
As we explained earlier this week, that agreement would give the US military access to use the company's services for mass domestic surveillance and  …
Read the full story at The Verge.
summary: On Friday afternoon, Donald Trump posted on Truth Social, accusing Anthropic, the AI company behind Claude, of attempting to "STRONG-ARM" the Pentagon and directing federal agencies to "IMMEDIATELY CEASE" use of its products. At issue is Anthropic CEO Dario Amodei's refusal of an updated agreement with the US military agreeing to "any lawful use" of […]

title: (No AI) Joint Statement from OpenAI and Microsoft
content: Microsoft and OpenAI continue to work closely across research, engineering, and product development, building on years of deep collaboration and shared success.
contentSnippet: Microsoft and OpenAI continue to work closely across research, engineering, and product development, building on years of deep collaboration and shared success.

title: (No AI) Introducing the Stateful Runtime Environment for Agents in Amazon Bedrock
content: Stateful Runtime for Agents in Amazon Bedrock brings persistent orchestration, memory, and secure execution to multi-step AI workflows powered by OpenAI.
contentSnippet: Stateful Runtime for Agents in Amazon Bedrock brings persistent orchestration, memory, and secure execution to multi-step AI workflows powered by OpenAI.

title: (No AI) Nano Banana 2: Combining Pro capabilities with lightning-fast speed
content: Our latest image generation model offers advanced world knowledge, production ready specs, subject consistency and more, all at Flash speed.
contentSnippet: Our latest image generation model offers advanced world knowledge, production ready specs, subject consistency and more, all at Flash speed.

title: (No AI) Gemini 3.1 Pro: A smarter model for your most complex tasks
content: 3.1 Pro is designed for tasks where a simple answer isn’t enough.

creator: Maxwell Zeff, Will Knight, Lauren Goode, Paresh Dave
title: (No AI) Anthropic Hits Back After US Military Labels It a ‘Supply Chain Risk’
dc:creator: Maxwell Zeff, Will Knight, Lauren Goode, Paresh Dave
content: Anthropic says it would be “legally unsound” for the Pentagon to blacklist its technology after talks over military use of its artificial intelligence models broke down.
contentSnippet: Anthropic says it would be “legally unsound” for the Pentagon to blacklist its technology after talks over military use of its artificial intelligence models broke down.

creator: Will Knight
title: (No AI) Trump Moves to Ban Anthropic From the US Government
dc:creator: Will Knight
content: President Donald Trump’s sudden order comes after the Defense Department pressured Anthropic to drop restrictions on how its AI can be used by the military.
contentSnippet: President Donald Trump’s sudden order comes after the Defense Department pressured Anthropic to drop restrictions on how its AI can be used by the military.
